intro: Eritrichium alfalfalis, commonly known as the alfalfa leaf salsify, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other flowering plants with small, four-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and along roadsides. Its leaves are alternate and pinnately divided, while its flowers are bright yellow with four petals. The plant produces small, elongated seed pods that contain numerous tiny seeds.
